activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
12:59 PM 22CF38/20CF56 -Defendant Dylan P. LeBlanc in the Grant County Jail.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Dylan P. LeBlanc.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea on 22CF38. Max penalties stated. 

Attorney Frank speaks about DL time in Grant County and asks for a November date. 
Court would like to see DL in person at the next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:30 PM Defendant Dylan P. LeBlanc not in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Dylan P. LeBlanc.  Attorney Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank states that DL is in the Grant County Jail. Court resets. 

Court asks Attorney Frank to make arrangements for DL to appear at the next hearing is he is still in the Grant County Jail.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM Defendant Dylan P. LeBlanc appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Dylan P. LeBlanc.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank hasn't been provided any information at this time. Attorney Forehand state that 20CF56 case has been resolved. Court proceeds with the preliminary hearing in 22CF38. State calls Officer Gerber. Sworn and testimony was given by Officer Gerber. Crossed by Attorney Frank. Redirect by Attorney Forehand and Attorney Frank. Attorney Frank begins argument. Court speaks about the statue. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.

20CF56 - Court speaks about the motion. Attorney Forehand ask that this be set for arraignment.
Parties speak about the case.  Court sets an arraignment in 22CF38 along with a motion hearing to revoke in 20CF56.
Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment on August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

01:22 PM Defendant Dylan P. LeBlanc appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appears by video. Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading. DL would like to speak about bail. Attorney McDougal states that the P/P hold has been dropped and asks for a signature bond or lower cash bond. Attorney Forehand comments. Court orders $10,000 signature bond. (max penalties were never stated)  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
